question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Struct: FrameTypeCache] [Transaction isolation violation] In Aptos's parallel execution model (Block-STM), can FrameTypeCache instances be shared between concurrent transactions, violating transaction isolation and causing state corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Enum: PerInstructionCache] [Speculative execution cache pollution] During speculative parallel execution, if a transaction's PerInstructionCache is populated then the transaction aborts and retries, is the cache properly cleared or does it contain stale speculative values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Function: get_field_type_and_struct_type()] [Read-write conflict] If multiple parallel transactions access get_field_type_and_struct_type() simultaneously, can read-write conflicts on the cache BTreeMap cause transaction aborts even when transactions don't actually conflict? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Struct: FrameTypeCache, Field: function_cache] [Parallel function call races] When parallel transactions call the same function, can concurrent mutations to the shared function_cache cause race conditions that result in cache corruption or deadlocks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Function: make_rc_for_function()] [Rc sharing across threads] If Rc<RefCell<FrameTypeCache>> is shared across parallel transaction threads, can this violate Rust's thread safety guarantees since Rc is not Send/Sync, causing undefined behavior? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Function: get_struct_type()] [Generic parameter substitution] When caching instantiated generic types, can incorrect type parameter substitution cause the cache to serve types where generic parameters don't match the actual instantiation context? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Function: get_signature_index_type()] [Type parameter bounds bypass] Does cached signature type instantiation preserve generic type parameter bounds (e.g., T: copy, T: drop), or can cache retrieval provide types that violate these constraints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Function: get_variant_field_type_and_struct_type()] [Instantiation vs definition mismatch] Can the instantiation type parameters in variant_field_instantiation_info_at differ from what's expected by the field type, causing type mismatches when the cache is used? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Struct: FrameTypeCache, Field: struct_variant_field_type_instantiation] [Variant generic confusion] For generic enum variants, can caching mix up which generic parameters apply to the enum vs the variant, causing incorrect type instantiations? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Struct: FrameTypeCache, Field: instantiated_local_tys] [Local type parameter shadowing] If generic function parameters shadow outer generic parameters, can cached instantiated_local_tys contain types instantiated with wrong type parameters? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Function: get_struct_fields_types()] [Field count invariant] Does the code validate that the cached Vec<(Type, NumTypeNodes)> length matches the actual struct definition field count, preventing out-of-bounds access? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Macro: get_or_insert!] [Insertion invariant violation] If the $ty_func closure returns a Type that doesn't actually correspond to the index being inserted, can the cache permanently store this incorrect mapping? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Struct: FrameTypeCache] [Cache coherence] Is there any mechanism to ensure that all BTreeMap caches remain coherent with each other (e.g., if struct type changes, all dependent field caches invalidate)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame_type_cache.rs] [Enum: PerInstructionCache] [Instruction cache validation] Before using cached PerInstructionCache entries, is there validation that the bytecode instruction at that index still matches the expected instruction type?
